instruct: Please investigate the global deployment and clinical outcomes of Al—assisted surgicalrobotics systems in cardiac, neurosurgical, and orthopedic procedures from 2022 to 2024 ,For each major system, document the manufacturer, FDA/CE approval dates, number of hospitals deployed, procedure types supported. Retrieve publishedclinical trial data showing complication rates, operation time reduction, and patientrecovery metrics compared to traditional surgery. Analyze which robotic systems have achieved the highest surgeon adoption rates and identify the key technological differentiators, citing peer—reviewed medical journals and regulatory filings.
result: 1 da Vinci Surgical System: manufacturer: Intuitive Surgical; FDA approval date	04/05/2023;hospital count: Over 7,500 worldwide (as of 2024)procedure types: General surgery, urology, gynecology, thoracic, cardiac;Pricing Model: Purchase ($1.5–2.5M), leasing (50% clients), plus per-procedure consumables (~$1,500);Complication Rates: No significant differences were observed between RC and LC in terms of bile leak rates (odds ratio, 0.37; 95% CI, 0.06–2.21; p = 0.27) or postoperative complications (odds ratio, 0.50; 95% CI, 0.18–1.37; p = 0.18).";  Operation Time: LC had a significantly shorter operation duration than RC (standardized mean difference: 0.27; 95% CI, 0.05–0.49; p = 0.01); Patient Recovery: Cost analysis revealed that RC was more cost-effective than LC (standardized mean difference, 3.16; 95% CI, 0.39–5.93; p = 0.03), with substantial heterogeneity noted among the studies.

2  MAKO: hospital count: Over 150+ in the U.S.procedure types: Total/partial knee replacement, total hip arthroplasty;Pricing Model: Purchase, leasing (via Flex Financial), and per-procedure kit costs;Operation Time:  reduction of 11 min in total OR time (p < 0.001);   Patient Recovery:   the use of thinner insert (p < 0.001), and a shorter mean length of stay of 1 day.

3 CorPath GRX : hospital count: At least 33 hospitals (31 U.S., 2 international, as of 2017); expanding globally;procedure types: brain aneurysms that required endovascular coiling and/or stent-assisted coiling.Complication Rates:  The primary safety goal was met, which was defined as patients treated without intra- and periprocedural adverse events，thromboembolic event with neurologic decline within 24 hours postprocedure or posthospital discharge, whichever occurred first.;   Operation Time:  The CorPath GRX system helps physicians move efficiently within tortuous and unstable vessels.; Patient Recovery:  78.2% of patients showed no clinical symptoms postprocedure, achieving a 0 on the Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) for neurologic disability. The remaining 21.8% of patients had an mRS of 1 or 2.

4 ExcelsiusGPS： hospital count: over 20 U.S. hospitals; procedure types: placing screws, interbody implants, and cranial instruments. Pricing Model: Purchase with navigation software subscription and support package;Complication Rates:  The primary safety goal was met, which was defined as patients treated without intra- and periprocedural adverse events，thromboembolic event with neurologic decline within 24 hours postprocedure or posthospital discharge, whichever occurred first.;   Operation Time:  The CorPath GRX system helps physicians move efficiently within tortuous and unstable vessels.; Patient Recovery:  78.2% of patients showed no clinical symptoms postprocedure, achieving a 0 on the Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) for neurologic disability. The remaining 21.8% of patients had an mRS of 1 or 2.

5 ROSA: hospital count: 100+ systems installed globally;procedure types: Total knee replacement, brain tumor biopsy, stereotactic neuro procedures;Pricing Model: Purchase (~$700K–1.5M), bundled software/maintenance contracts;

The da Vinci Surgical System is the most widely adopted surgical robot globally, used by thousands of surgeons across over 7,500 hospitals. Its key technological differentiators include: (1) 3D HD vision with tremor filtration and motion scaling, (2) EndoWrist® instruments providing superior dexterity, and (3) integrated fluorescence imaging enabling real-time tissue assessment.

Case:Formula One (F1) is leveraging Salesforce to manage its expanding global fanbase and enhance fan engagement. As the sport's popularity has surged, F1 has faced the challenge of personalizing experiences for its millions of fans, most of whom interact with the sport through digital channels. This has resulted in a massive amount of data from over 100 sources. To address this, F1 implemented a suite of Salesforce products, including Service Cloud, Data Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Tableau, and Sales Cloud. This has enabled F1 to: Achieve 80% faster service response times. Increase clicks on agent-generated content by 22%. Reduce call handling time by 50%. Boost fan satisfaction to 90%, an 8% year-over-year increase. Furthermore, F1 utilizes Tableau to provide valuable audience insights to its commercial partners, which has helped in securing new sponsorships. The implementation of Data Cloud, completed in under four months with the assistance of Salesforce Professional Services and Ogilvy, has set F1 on a course to expand its known fanbase to 43 million by 2027.

instruct: List the top three highest-grossing documentary films worldwide from 2022 to 2024, including title, director, distributor, release date, global box office, number of core crew members, awards, and the highest-rated user comment from Douban/IMDb.
result: Top three documentaries by box office and their revenues: 1.Beijing 2022 (2023), $24,790,100 2.Moonage Daydream (2022), $13,910,491 3.Am I Racist? (2024), $12,311,598

Collect the director, distributor, release time, the number of main creative team members, major awards and winning situations, as well as the short review with the highest IMDb score of Beijing 2022: Chuan Lu, Feet Films, Apr 22, 2023 (Beijing Intl Film Fest), ~14, 3 WINS & 2 NOMINATIONS: Golden Rooster Awards，Beijing Student Film Festival，Chinese American Film Festival (C.A.F.F.)，Academy Award of Beijing Film Academy，Silk Road International Film Festival China, None

Collect the director, distributor, release time, the number of main creative team members, major awards and winning situations, as well as the short review with the highest IMDb score of Moonage Daydream: Brett Morgen, Neon (US), Universal Pictures Intl, Sep 14, 2022 (EMEA), Sep 16 US IMAX, Sep 23 US wide, ~85, 15 wins & 52 nominations: American Cinema Editors, USA，BAFTA Awards, Cannes Film Festival,Chicago Film Critics Association Awards.etc, It's not a biography, it's a senses attack. Saw this in IMAX 2d. Loud, vivid, it's not a biography, it's an exploration and celebration of Bowie's life, art, and music. Made up of clips cleverly edited together and enhanced to make this a cinematic experience . See it as big and loud as you can and get lost in Bowie. It needs to be three hours longer to fit in everything the stuff others are moaning about not being there. I'd happily have done another 3 hours of this. Came out wanting to listen to all the album's again and smoke cigarettes and bleach my hair and wear a raincoat. Everything i wanted to be in the eighties, I want again after watching Bowie come to life once more.

Collect the director, distributor, release time, the number of main creative team members, major awards and winning situations, as well as the short review with the highest IMDb score of Am I Racist?: Justin Folk, SDG Releasing, Sep, 13, 2024 (US wide) ,  ~47, 0 wins / multiple nominations, Epic! One of the best films of the last 20 years! I can't wait for more movies from him 👍 I suggest that everyone I know, and everyone they know, go see this movie. I felt like I was right there with him on every step of his journey. It's an inspirational piece of art. We should honestly all go see it twice... nay, thrice! Be a part of one of the greatest new movement in moving picture film, I truly believe this masterpiece will be a historical hit, and I also believe everyone could learn some amazing things from watching this film. Please view responsibly, may cause sudden shift in opinions and perspective 👍 party on Wayne!

instruct: List the single ski resort with the highest number of annual visitors in world-renowned ski destinations in 2024 , including the name of the ski resort, the country and city it is located in, annual visitor volume, the length of its longest ski run, the main lift supplier and its maximum capacity, ticket prices, and the management company.
result: the name of the ski resort: Campiglio Dolomiti di Brenta
the country and city it is located in:   Trentino, Italy
annual visitor volume: more than 2.5 million.
the length of its longest ski run: 5.8  km
the main lift supplier and its maximum capacity: Doppelmayr; 3,600pax/h

ticket prices: The 2024/25 ski pass prices for Pinzolo vary by season and duration: 1-day passes cost €56/39/28 (adult/junior/child) in low season, €60/42/30 in high season, and €65/46/33 during Christmas and New Year. Multi-day passes (2 to 8 days) in low season range from €110 to €329 for adults, €77 to €230 for juniors, and €55 to €165 for children; in high season, from €118 to €369 for adults, €83 to €258 for juniors, and €59 to €185 for children. 9 to 14-day passes are €26/18/13 in low season and €28/20/14 in high season. The “5 days out of 7” option costs €255/179/128 in low season and €286/200/143 in high season (adult/junior/child). The 2024/25 per-hour ski pass prices vary by season: In low season, adult rates are €22, €34, €42, and €48; junior €15, €24, €29, and €34; child €11, €17, €21, and €24 for 1 to 4 hours respectively. In high season, adult rates are €24, €35, €44, and €50; junior €17, €25, €31, and €35; child €12, €18, €22, and €25. During Christmas and New Year, adult rates are €26, €39, €49, and €55; junior €18, €27, €34, and €39; child €13, €20, €25, and €28. The 2024/25 Skiarea Skipass, valid across Madonna di Campiglio, Pinzolo, Folgarida-Marilleva, and Pejo, costs €72/50/36 (adult/junior/child) for 1 day in low season and €79/55/40 in high season, with multi-day passes ranging from €142 to €438 in low season and €156 to €492 in high season, and 9–14 day rates set at €34/24/17 (low) and €37/26/19 (high).
management company: Funivie Folgarida Marilleva S.p.A. ， Funivie Madonna di Campiglio S.p.A. ， Funivie Pinzolo S.p.A.

instruct: Screen for international biodiversity conservation agreements signed between countries worldwide and the European Union from 2018 to 2024. Identify the agreement with the largest number of signatories, and list the agreement name, signing date, main signatory countries, primary objectives, reduction targets allocated to each country, the city where the secretariat is established and the total number of pages in the English original agreement text.
result: The Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (GBF), adopted on 19 December 2022
with 196 parties China, Canada, European Union, Brazil, France

1. The integrity, resilience, and connectivity of ecosystems is maintained, enhanced, or restored, substantially increasing the area of natural ecosystems by 2050, and that human-induced extinction of threatened species is halted, and that by 2050, extinction rate and risk of all species are reduced tenfold, and the abundance of native wild species is increased to healthy and resilient levels; and that the genetic diversity within populations of wild and domesticated species, is maintained, safeguarding their adaptive potential.

2. Biodiversity is sustainably used and managed and nature’s contributions to people, including ecosystem functions and services, are valued, maintained and enhanced, with those currently in decline being restored, supporting the achievement of sustainable development, for the benefit of present and future generations by 2050.

3. The monetary and non-monetary benefits from the utilization of genetic resources, and digital sequence information on genetic resources, and of traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources, as applicable, are shared fairly and equitably, including, as appropriate with indigenous peoples and local communities, and substantially increased by 2050, while ensuring traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources is appropriately protected, thereby contributing to the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity, in accordance with internationally agreed access and benefit-sharing instruments.

4.Adequate means of implementation, including financial resources, capacity-building, technical and scientific cooperation, and access to and transfer of technology to fully implement the Kunming-Montreal global biodiversity framework are secured and equitably accessible to all Parties, especially developing countries, in particular the least developed countries and small island developing States, as well as countries with economies in transition, progressively closing the biodiversity finance gap of $700 billion per year, and aligning financial flows with the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework and the 2050 Vision for Biodiversity.

Canada:Better land use planning management; Environmentally sustainable management across sectors; Improving information about biodiversity ecosystem services; Raising awareness of biodiversity and encouraging participation in conservation.

China: Complete baseline surveys and evaluations of biodiversity in 8 to 10 priority conservation areas and implement effective monitoring and control.  Maintain the total area of territorial nature reserves at 15% or so of China’s total land area with strengthened in-situ conservation to conserve 90% of the national key protected species and typical ecosystems.  Implement ex-situ conservation rationally and effectively to protect over 80% of threatened species of very small wild populations which are insufficiently conserved in-situ.  Establish a system of biodiversity monitoring, evaluation and warning, and set up a system to manage trade in biological resources as well as a system for access to and benefit sharing of genetic resources.

instruct: Find laboratories worldwide that achieved breakthrough discoveries in high-temperature superconducting materials from 2019 to 2024, listing the laboratory name, affiliated university/research institute, year of discovery, material type and key parameters, corresponding paper title, first paragraph of the abstract, and the first author's name.
result: the laboratory name: Argonne National Laboratory
affiliated university/research institute: the Carnegie Institution of Washington
material type and key parameters: the sample cooled below 260 K (minus 13 C, or 8 F) at 180-200 gigapascals of pressure
corresponding paper title: Evidence for superconductivity above 260 K in lanthanum superhydride at megabar pressures

first paragraph of the abstract: Recent predictions and experimental observations of high Tc superconductivity in hydrogen-rich materials at very high pressures are driving the search for superconductivity in the vicinity of room temperature. We have developed a novel preparation technique that is optimally suited for megabar pressure syntheses of superhydrides using pulsed laser heating while maintaining the integrity of sample-probe contacts for electrical transport measurements to 200 GPa. We detail the synthesis and characterization, including four-probe electrical transport measurements, of lanthanum superhydride samples that display a significant drop in resistivity on cooling beginning around 260 K and pressures of 190 GPa. Additional measurements on two additional samples synthesized the same way show resistance drops beginning as high as 280 K at these pressures. The loss of resistance at these high temperatures is not observed in control experiments on pure La as well as in partially transformed samples at these pressures, and x-ray diffraction as a function of temperature on the superhydride reveal no structural changes on cooling. We infer that the resistance drop is a signature of the predicted room-temperature superconductivity in LaH10, in good agreement with density functional structure search and BCS theory calculations.
the first author's name: Maddury Somayazulu

result: Evidence for superconductivity above 260 K in lanthanum superhydride at megabar pressures

Recent predictions and experimental observations of high Tc superconductivity in hydrogen-rich materials at very high pressures are driving the search for superconductivity in the vicinity of room temperature. We have developed a novel preparation technique that is optimally suited for megabar pressure syntheses of superhydrides using pulsed laser heating while maintaining the integrity of sample-probe contacts for electrical transport measurements to 200 GPa. We detail the synthesis and characterization, including four-probe electrical transport measurements, of lanthanum superhydride samples that display a significant drop in resistivity on cooling beginning around 260 K and pressures of 190 GPa. Additional measurements on two additional samples synthesized the same way show resistance drops beginning as high as 280 K at these pressures. The loss of resistance at these high temperatures is not observed in control experiments on pure La as well as in partially transformed samples at these pressures, and x-ray diffraction as a function of temperature on the superhydride reveal no structural changes on cooling. We infer that the resistance drop is a signature of the predicted room-temperature superconductivity in LaH10, in good agreement with density functional structure search and BCS theory calculations.

instruct: Identify the first country in the world to legally recognize the inheritance rights of 'digital inheritance'. List (1) the country name, (2) the official title of the relevant act, (3) the year it was passed, and (4) the specific legal definition of 'digital assets' as stated in the law.
result: (2) Official Title of the Act: General Principles of Civil Law of the People’s Republic of China, later incorporated into the Civil Code of the PRC
(3) Year It Was Passed: 2017 (General Principles), 2020 (full Civil Code)

(4) Definition of Digital Assets: While the law does not offer a standalone formal definition, Article 127 of the Civil Code recognizes “data” and “online virtual property”  as legally protected civil rights and allows them to be inherited. These include internet-based assets such as digital wallets (e.g., Alipay, WeChat Pay), online game items, cloud-stored content, and social media accounts, treated as lawful personal property.

instruct: Find mathematicians who won the Fields Medal between 2017 and 2024, identify the winner with the most papers published on ArXiv in the five years prior to the award, and list: (1) mathematician's name, (2) award year, (3) total number of ArXiv papers, (4) title and number of downloads of the most downloaded paper, and (5) the original text of the first paragraph of the introduction of that paper.
result: title: High action orbits for Tonelli Lagrangians and superlinear Hamiltonians on compact configuration spaces

paragraph: Abstract: Multiplicity results for solutions of various boundary value problems are known for dynamical systems on compact configuration manifolds, given by Lagrangians or Hamiltonians which have quadratic growth in the velocities or in the momenta. Such results are based on the richness of the topology of the space of curves satisfying the given boundary conditions. In this note we show how these results can be extended to the classical setting of Tonelli Lagrangians (Lagrangians which are -convex and superlinear in the velocities), or to Hamiltonians which are superlinear in the momenta and have a coercive action integrand.
